TicketRestriction.Name: 1A
TicketRestriction.Easement:
The following easements apply on Greater Anglia services from Monday to Friday inclusive:

  • 08:11 Clacton-on Sea to London Liverpool Street service - from Clacton, Thorpe-le-Soken, Weeley, Great Bentley, Alresford, Wivenhoe and Hythe to all destinations.
  • 08:00 Walton-on-the-Naze to Colchester service - from Walton, Frinton-on-Sea and Kirby Cross to all destinations.
  • 08:28 Harwich Town to Manningtree service - from stations Harwich Town to Mistley inclusive, to all destinations.
  • 09:02 London Liverpool Street to Ipswich service - from Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Chappel & Wakes Colne, Bures and Sudbury only, changing at Marks Tey.
  • 09:18 London Liverpool Street to Clacton-on-Sea service - from Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Wivenhoe, Thorpe-le-Soken, Clacton, Kirby Cross, Frinton-on-Sea and Walton-on-the-Naze.
  • 16:30 London Liverpool Street to Norwich service - from Liverpool Street to Derby Road (Ipswich), Trimley and Felixstowe only, changing at Ipswich.
  • 16:32 London Liverpool Street to Ipswich service - from Liverpool Street to Derby Road (Ipswich), Trimley and Felixstowe only, changing at Ipswich.
  • 16:34 London Liverpool Street to Braintree service - from Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Hatfield Peverel, White Notley, Cressing, Braintree Freeport and Braintree only.
  • 18:12 London Liverpool Street to Ipswich service - from Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Chappel & Wakes Colne, Bures and Sudbury only, changing at Marks Tey.
  • 18:19 London Liverpool Street to Walton-on-the-Naze service - from Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to stations Alresford to Walton-on-the-Naze inclusive.
  • 18:30 London Liverpool Street to Norwich service - from Liverpool Street to Derby Road (Ipswich), Trimley and Felixstowe only, changing at Ipswich.
TicketRestriction.SeasonalVariations:
School Holidays - Evening peak restrictions on return journeys from Liverpool Street, Stratford (London) and Tottenham Hale to Ipswich and beyond (also to Brandon and beyond via Cambridge) are lifted during school holidays and half-term weeks: 

2019

Christmas: Thursday 19th December to Friday 3rd January 2020.

2020

Half-term: Monday 17th to Friday 21st February
Easter: Friday 3rd to Friday 17th April (Friday 10th and Monday 13th are public holidays)
Half-term: Tuesday 26th to Friday 29th May (Monday 25th May is a public holiday)
Summer: Thursday 23rd July to Wednesday 2nd September (Monday 31st August is a public holiday)
Half-term: Monday 26th to Friday 30th October
Christmas: Monday 21st to Thursday 31st December (Friday 1 January 2021 is a public holiday)

All dates are inclusive. Dates are taken from the Norfolk County Council school holiday calendar. Teacher training days are excluded.

Restriction.DetailsOutward: Not valid on any train timed to arrive at London Liverpool Street (or London Kings Cross or London St Pancras International from East Anglia via Cambridge) after 04:29 and before 10:00, and at Stratford (London) before 09:50 and Tottenham Hale or Seven Sisters before 09:40.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:
Not valid on any train departing London Liverpool Street (or London Kings Cross or passing through London St Pancras International to East Anglia via Cambridge) before 09:30, or after 16:29 and before 18:35.

Not valid on north- or eastbound trains departing Stratford (London) before 09:38 or after 16:36 and before 18:43.

Not valid on northbound trains departing Tottenham Hale before 09:40 or after 16:41 and before 18:46.

Not valid on northbound trains departing Seven Sisters before 09:40 or after 16:44 and before 18:50.

Restriction.DetailsOutward: Not valid on trains timed to arrive in London Liverpool Street or London Kings Cross after 04:29 and before 10:00.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: Not valid on trains timed to depart London Terminals after 04:29 and before 09:30

Greater Anglia services:

  • 08:11 Clacton-on-Sea to London Liverpool Street service - from Clacton, Thorpe-le-Soken, Great Bentley, Alresford and Wivenhoe to all destinations.
  • 08:00 Walton-on-the-Naze to Colchester service - from Walton-on-the-Naze, Frinton-on-Sea and Kirby Cross to all destinations.

  • 09:02 London Liverpool Street to Ipswich service - from London Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Chappel & Wakes Colne, Bures and Sudbury (Suffolk) only, changing at Marks Tey.
  • 09:18 London Liverpool Street to Clacton-on-Sea service - from London Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Wivenhoe, Thorpe-le-Soken, Clacton-on-Sea, Kirby Cross, Frinton-on-Sea and Walton-on-the-Naze.
  • 09:28 London Liverpool Street to Cambridge service - from London Liverpool Street to all destinations.
  • 16:34 London Liverpool Street to Braintree service - from London Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Hatfield Peverel, White Notley, Cressing, Braintree Freeport and Braintree only.
  • 18:12 London Liverpool Street to Ipswich service - from London Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Chappel & Wakes Colne, Bures and Sudbury only, changing at Marks Tey.
  • 18:32 London Liverpool Street to Walton-on-the-Naze service - from London Liverpool Street and Stratford (London) to Hatfield Peverel and Kelvedon, also to stations Alresford to Walton-on-the-Naze.

2019

Christmas: Friday 20th December to Friday 3rd January 2020

2020

Half-term: Monday 17th to Friday 21st February
Easter: Friday 3rd to Friday 17th April (Friday 10th and Monday 13th are public holidays)
Half-term: Tuesday 26th to Friday 29th May (Monday 25th May is a public holiday)
Summer: Thursday 23rd July to Wednesday 2nd September (Monday 31st August is a public holiday)
Half-term: Monday 26th to Friday 30th October
Christmas: Friday 21st to Thursday 31st December (Friday 1st January 2020 is a public holiday)

Not valid on trains timed to arrive:

  • Into London Terminals or Stevenage after 02:59 until 10:59.

Not valid on trains timed to depart:

  • From London Terminals or Stevenage after 02:59 and until 09:53; or,
  • From London Terminals after 15:39 until 19:02; or,
  • From Stevenage after 15:54 until 19:02.

TicketRestriction.Name: EF
TicketRestriction.Notes: Valid only between any two stations in the 'n-Network' area and for travel wholly within the 'n-Network' area i.e. not valid for travel out of the area and back in again, even if between two 'n-Network' area stations.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Valid only between any two stations in the 'n-Network' area (see notes)

Not valid on trains timed to depart before 18:30.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:
Valid only between any two stations in the 'n-Network' area (see notes).

Not valid on trains timed to depart before 18:30.

Return journey must be made the same evening as the outward journey.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Not valid on trains timed to depart London Euston before 09:15 or London St Pancras International before 09:00.

The n-Network Super Off-Peak (evening single/return fare) is a flat fare generally available after 18:30 but on this journey an easement applies allowing travel from 18:24 within the n-Network (Network West Midlands PTE) area.

It is available:

  • Between any two stations in the Network West Midlands area but only after 18:30 Mondays to Sundays.
  • Return journeys must be made the same evening as the outward journey.
  • Available to adults, children and groups of 4 (children will be allowed as a part of the group as long as at least one adult is in the group). The group must travel together as only one ticket will be issued.
  • This fare is not available to unaccompanied children.

Period of validity as per the date of travel shown on the ticket.

n-Network Super Off-Peak fares are available from staffed Ticket Offices and on-train when the customer has boarded at an unstaffed station.

n-Network Super Off-Peak fares cannot be purchased for travel on the last running rail service of the day.

No Railcard discounts allowed.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:
Not valid on trains timed to depart London Euston before 09:15 or London St Pancras International before 09:00.

The n-Network Super Off-Peak (evening single/return fare) is a flat fare generally available after 18:30 but on this journey an easement applies allowing travel from 18:24 within the n-Network (Network West Midlands PTE) area.

It is available:

  • Between any two stations in the Network West Midlands area but only after 18:30 Mondays to Sundays.
  • Return journeys must be made the same evening as the outward journey.
  • Available to adults, children and groups of 4 (children will be allowed as a part of the group as long as at least one adult is in the group). The group must travel together as only one ticket will be issued.
  • This fare is not available to unaccompanied children.

Period of validity as per the date of travel shown on the ticket.

n-Network Super Off-Peak fares are available from staffed Ticket Offices and on-train when the customer has boarded at an unstaffed station.

n-Network Super Off-Peak fares cannot be purchased for travel on the last running rail service of the day.

No Railcard discounts allowed.

Not valid on trains departing from London St. Pancras International or London Kings Cross after 16:29 and before 18:31.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Valid:

  • The fare is available between any two stations in the Network West Midlands area but only available to the "Friends and Family" on the routes covered by the holder's season ticket.
  • Tickets are available for travel after 09:30 Mondays to Fridays and any time on Saturdays and Sundays.
  • For one adult and up to two children to accompany the season ticket holder.
  • Valid season tickets are: nNetwork (1 week, 4 weeks, 13 weeks and annual). nTrain 1 week, 4 weeks, 1 month and any period of validity between 1 month and annual.
  • Also between Walsall and Rugeley Trent Valley if a valid nTrain season ticket is held.
  • Also valid in conjunction with all Cross-boundary nTrain season tickets.
  • As per the date of travel shown on the ticket.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:
Valid:

  • The fare is available between any two stations in the Network West Midlands area but only available to the "Friends and Family" on the routes covered by the holder's season ticket.
  • Tickets are available for travel after 09:30 Mondays to Fridays and any time on Saturdays and Sundays.
  • For one adult and up to two children to accompany the season ticket holder.
  • Valid season tickets are: nNetwork (1 week, 4 weeks, 13 weeks and annual). nTrain 1 week, 4 weeks, 1 month and any period of validity between 1 month and annual.
  • Also between Walsall and Rugeley Trent Valley if a valid nTrain season ticket is held.
  • Also valid in conjunction with all Cross-boundary nTrain season tickets.
  • As per the date of travel shown on the ticket.

TicketRestriction.Name: G1
TicketRestriction.SeasonalVariations: The evening peak restriction ONLY is lifted on Monday 24 December, Thursday 27 December, Friday 28 December and Monday 31 December 2018.

Restriction.DetailsOutward: By any train except those timed to depart Mondays‐Fridays before 09:30 but if fare is £6.90 or more, a 'nNetwork Daytripper' must be issued.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: By any train except those timed to depart Monday - Fridays before 09:30

TicketRestriction.Name: G2
TicketRestriction.SeasonalVariations: The evening peak restriction ONLY is lifted on Monday 24 December, Thursday 27 December, Friday 28 December and Monday 31 December 2018.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
By any train except those timed to depart Mondays‐Fridays before 09:26 but if fare is £6.90 or more, a 'nNetwork Daytripper' must be issued.

The restriction for this ticket is generally 09:30 but an easement applies to this journey.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: By any train except those timed to depart Mondays - Fridays before 09:26

TicketRestriction.Name: G5
TicketRestriction.SeasonalVariations:
Restrictions will be lifted in both directions between Wednesday 23rd December 2020 and Sunday 3rd January 2021 inclusive.

Normal restrictions will apply to other Train Operator's services unless advised otherwise.

TicketRestriction.Name: GF
TicketRestriction.SeasonalVariations: The evening peak restriction ONLY is lifted on Thursday 24 December, Tuesday 29 December, Wednesday 30 December and Thursday 31 December 2020.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Not valid on trains timed to depart before 09:30.

In addition, not valid on any train departing Birmingham New Street, Birmingham Snow Hill, Birmingham Moor Street, Five Ways or Jewellery Quarter between 16:34 and 18:01.

This does not apply if passengers hold tickets for through journeys, i.e. if a change of train is required at one of these five stations to complete their journey.

If fare is £6.90 or more, an 'nNetwork Daytripper' should be issued.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:
Not valid on trains timed to depart before 09:30.

In addition, not valid Mondays ‐ Fridays on any train departing Birmingham New Street, Birmingham Snow Hill, Birmingham Moor Street, Five Ways or Jewellery Quarter between 16:34 and 18:01.

This does not apply if passengers hold tickets for through journeys, i.e. if a change of train is required at one of these five stations to complete their journey.

TicketRestriction.SeasonalVariations:
Evening peak restrictions from Liverpool Street, Stratford (London) and Tottenham Hale are lifted during school holiday and half-term periods, as follows:           

2019

Christmas: Friday 20th December to Friday 3rd January 2020

2020

Half-term: Monday 17th to Friday 21st February
Easter: Friday 3rd to Friday 17th April (Friday 10th and Monday 13th are public holidays)
Half-term: Tuesday 26th to Friday 29th May (Monday 25th May is a public holiday)
Summer: Thursday 23rd July to Wednesday 2nd September (Monday 31st August is a public holiday)
Half-term: Monday 26th October to Friday 30th October
Christmas: Monday 21st to Friday 31st December (1st January 2021 is a public holiday)

All dates are inclusive. Dates are taken from the Norfolk County Council school holiday calendar. Teacher training days are excluded.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
The n-Network add-on season ticket can only be used for travel when an accompanying valid n-Network ticket is held.

The n-Network add-on provides rail travel only from selected stations to the nearest point in the West Midlands county by any permitted route.

The ticket restrictions applicable to the n-Network ticket also apply to the n-Network add-on.

n-Network Add-on tickets are not valid in conjunction with n-Train tickets.

It is valid for travel:

  • On all train companies' services on the permitted routes.
  • Using the same restrictions applicable to the corresponding n-Network ticket.
  • On rail services only.
  • All day during the period of validity.

Available from selected stations in the n-Network.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:

  • Using the same restrictions applicable to the corresponding n-Network ticket.
  • On rail services only.
  • All day during the period of validity.

Available from selected stations in the n-Network.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Not valid on trains timed to depart after 04:29 and before 09:30 or after 16:00 and before 18:30.

The restriction after 16:00 and before 18:30 includes any connecting train departing during this period (or re-commencing your journey following a break of journey) within the following areas:

  • Transport for Greater Manchester area plus Alderley Edge, Birchwood, Burscough Bridge, Disley,  Handforth, Hoscar, New Mills Central, New Mills Newtown, Padgate, Parbold, Styal, Warrington Bank Quay, Warrington Central, and Wilmslow;
  • Travel South Yorkshire area plus, Darton, Denby Dale, Moorthorpe and South Elmsall;
  • West Yorkshire Metro area plus Cononley, Harrogate,  Hornbeam Park, Knaresborough, Pannal, Skipton, Starbeck and Weeton.

Valid trains can also be checked using the journey planner at www.nationalrail.co.uk  

Further information including maps of the restricted areas can be found on the Northern website.

  • Transport for Greater Manchester area plus Alderley Edge, Birchwood, Burscough Bridge, Disley,  Handforth, Hoscar, New Mills Central, New Mills Newtown, Padgate, Parbold, Styal, Warrington Bank Quay, Warrington Central, and Wilmslow;
  • Travel South Yorkshire area plus, Darton, Denby Dale, Moorthorpe and South Elmsall;
  • West Yorkshire Metro area plus Cononley, Harrogate,  Hornbeam Park, Knaresborough, Pannal, Skipton, Starbeck and Weeton.

Valid trains can also be checked using the journey planner at www.nationalrail.co.uk  

Further information including maps of the restricted areas can be found on the Northern website.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Valid on Greater Anglia (TOC Code: LER) services only.

Seat reservations are compulsory.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: Not applicable.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Valid on Greater Anglia (TOC Code: LER) and connecting services.

Seat reservations are compulsory.

Restrictions apply on connecting trains from Kent into London St. Pancras International and vice versa via line High Speed 1 (HS1) on Mondays to Fridays as follows:

Not valid on HS1 trains timed to arrive in London St. Pancras International before 09:59;

Not valid on HS1 trains timed to depart London St. Pancras International after 15:59 until 19:00.

Not valid on HS1 trains timed to arrive in Stratford International before 09:50;

Not valid on HS1 trains timed to depart Stratford International after 16:10 until 19:10.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: Not applicable.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Valid on Greater Anglia (TOC Code: LER) and connecting services.

Seat reservations are compulsory.

Tickets with a Route Code of 'AP', 'GA' & 'HS1' may be used on Southeastern's services via High Speed One at any time.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: Not applicable.

TicketRestriction.Name: OD
TicketRestriction.Notes: The ticket is only valid for use within the Network West Midlands (NWM) area. It is valid on all train companies services that operate within the NWM area for an unlimited number of journeys on the date printed on the ticket. There is no child version of this ticket.

Restriction.DetailsOutward: nNetwork One Day tickets are valid for use all day (including the morning peak) on weekday rail, metro and bus services.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: nNetwork One Day tickets are valid for use all day (including the morning peak) on weekday rail, metro and bus services.

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Validity based on the time of touch in on the Oyster card validator at the origin station of the journey:

Mondays-Fridays valid between 06:30-09:30 and 16:00-19:00. Not applicable all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Contactless Payment Card or Oyster card with pay as you go credit required. Not to be issued as traditional “paper” ticket.

Charges capped at daily price cap limit, based on all journeys made on the card between 04:30 and 04:29 the following day.
Restriction.DetailsReturn: Not applicable.

TicketRestriction.Name: SF

Restriction.DetailsOutward:
Valid on date shown on ticket only.

Not valid for trains timed to depart before 09:30 on Fridays. Valid all day Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays.

No break of journey is permitted.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:
Return travel must be completed within three days of outward travel.

Valid on any train.

Break of journey is permitted.

Normal break of journey rules apply to the return portion.

  • on the 18:11 CrossCountry service from Edinburgh to Aberdeen on Saturdays;
  • on the 18:13 CrossCountry service from Edinburgh to Aberdeen on Sundays.
Restriction.DetailsReturn:

  • on the 18:11 CrossCountry service from Edinburgh to Aberdeen on Saturdays;
  • on the 18:13 CrossCountry service from Edinburgh to Aberdeen on Sundays.
